animals.name: Peacock
animals.description: Peacocks aren't great at flying, so they eat insects, small animals and plants that they find on the ground.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the peacock! Peacocks show off their tail feathers to impress others.

animals.name: Walrus
animals.description: Walruses spend most of their lives in very cold waters, migrating with floating sea ice to find food.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the walrus! This blubber lover eats lots of snacks to stay warm in the cold winter.

animals.name: Koala
animals.description: Koalas sleep for about 18 hours each day, and spend the rest of their day eating eucalyptus leaves.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the koala! Don't expect it to stay awake though - koalas sleep for 18 hours a day!

animals.name: Bee
animals.description: These fuzzy bees nest in cavities, such as old bird's nests or in moss mats in lawns.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the bumblebee! These furry fellows go from flower to flower to collect pollen and nectar.

animals.name: Clown Fish
animals.description: Clownfish live in groups, and talk to one another by making popping and clicking noises.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the clownfish! They swim playfully among anemones to stay safe.

animals.name: Platypus
animals.description: Even though Platypuses are mammals, they lay eggs which is very rare for mammals.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the platypus! With a bill like a duck and a tail like a beaver, the platypus is a unique looking mammal!

animals.name: Cephalopod
animals.description: Shelled cephalopods have been around for over 500 million years, making them older than dinosaurs!
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the shelled cephalopod! This cephalopod wears a twisty shell on its back, always ready for an adventure.

animals.name: Stag Beetle
animals.description: Stag beetles spend most of their life as a grub underground eating decomposing wood.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the stag beetle! Male stag beetles use their impressive jaws to fight one another.

animals.name: Snowy Owl
animals.description: Snowy owls have white feathers to blend into the snow of the tundra, protecting them from predators.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the snowy owl! A silent hunter in the arctic, the snowy owl glides gracefully through the snow.

animals.name: Orangutan
animals.description: Orangutans have hands and feet that are equally skillful, and are happy to eat with their feet.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the orangutan! Swinging from tree to tree with their long arms, orangutans explore the jungle.

animals.name: Jellyfish
animals.description: Moon Jellyfish go with the flow on the ocean currents, eating tiny prey which drift into their short tentacles.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the jellyfish! It goes with the flow, following the movement of the ocean's currents.

animals.name: Robin
animals.description: Despite their cute appearance, robins are fiercely territorial and do their best to scare off intruders with their loud call.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the European robin! With its bright red chest and distinct call, robins are easy to spot.

animals.name: Velociraptor
animals.description: Velociraptors had great vision, sharp claws, and were very fast, making them excellent hunters.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the velociraptor! These feathered dinosaurs were fast as a flash, making them great hunters.

animals.name: Fox
animals.description: The red fox often lives near cities, where there are fewer predators and more food available.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the fox! This clever creature enjoys sneaking through gardens at night.

animals.name: Puffin
animals.description: Puffins are excellent at flying and swimming, and use their wings as flippers when they're underwater.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the puffin! These seabirds spend much of their life hunting for fish at sea.

animals.name: Tiger Cub
animals.description: Newborn tiger cubs are born blind, and don't open their eyes for about two weeks!
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the tiger cub! Playful and curious, this little cub is learning the ways of the jungle.

animals.name: Grass Snake
animals.description: Grass snakes eat frogs and newts, which they swallow whole and often while still alive!
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the grass snake! Experts at slithering and sliding around, grass snakes are also great swimmers.

animals.name: Dodo
animals.description: Today dodos are extinct, but they once were a flightless bird that lived in Mauritius, off the coast of Africa.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the dodo! Large and flightless, this extinct bird is related to pigeons.

animals.name: Ostrich
animals.description: Ostriches might not be able to fly, but they can run twice as fast as a human, and have a very strong kick.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the ostrich! The fastest bird on land, ostriches are always ready to dash across the plains.

animals.name: Crocodile
animals.description: Crocodiles have one of the strongest bites in the animal kingdom, and can eat half their body weight in one meal.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the Nile Crocodile! Just don't get in the way of its strong bite - one of the strongest bites in the animal kingdom!

animals.name: Butterfly
animals.description: Butterflies are beautiful insects that go through metamorphosis.
animals.badgeDescription: Nice job, you found the butterfly! A beautiful and delicate discovery.

gameBadges.name: Garden Grower
gameBadges.description: A true green finger! You planted a beautiful garden for the bees.

gameBadges.name: Fancy Feeder
gameBadges.description: Top marks for tossing molluscs! You're the Walrus' favourite feeder.

gameBadges.name: Careful Cleaner
gameBadges.description: Great work, you've left the anemones sparkling and created a healthy home for the clownfish.

gameBadges.name: Peacock Paparazzi
gameBadges.description: Perfect timing! You took a photo of the peacock's proudest moment.

gameBadges.name: Streak Master
gameBadges.description: Earn this badge by playing three days in a row!

gameBadges.name: Jellyfish Juggler
gameBadges.description: Nice shot! You spotted the Moon Jellyfish in the crowd and took a fabulous photo!
